decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources through removal spells and counterspells while ramping up mana using cards like Growth Spiral and Nissa, Who Shakes the World. It utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler and Oko, Thief of Crowns to manipulate the battlefield and generate card advantage. The creatures in the deck, such as Hydroid Krasis and Gilded Goose, provide additional value and can help stabilize the board. Overall, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and maintain control of the game until the player can dominate with their high-impact spells and threats.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to dominate the opponent by countering or removing threats while also generating card advantage through cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Expansion / Explosion. The deck also utilizes Wilderness Reclamation to generate a large amount of mana and cast multiple spells in a turn. By gaining incremental advantages and controlling the pace of the game, this deck seeks to outvalue the opponent and secure victory through attrition.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly with mana dorks and acceleration spells, utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Nissa and Oko to control the board and generate advantage. With access to cards like Mass Manipulation and Hydroid Krasis, the deck aims to outvalue opponents by stealing their creatures and gaining life. The inclusion of cards like Aether Gust and Wicked Wolf provides additional ways to control the opponent's threats and maintain a strong board presence. Ultimately, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its versatile control and power cards.

This deck focuses on quickly building up an aggressive board presence through the use of adventure cards and cheap creatures. By utilizing cards like Blacklance Paragon and Foulmire Knight to gain tempo advantage, the deck can overwhelm opponents in the early game. The synergy between cards like Lucky Clover and Edgewall Innkeeper allows for efficient card draw and additional value from adventure spells. With a mix of removal and card advantage, this deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and outpace them in the race to victory.

This deck focuses on quickly developing a strong board presence using adventure creatures like Foulmire Knight and Lovestruck Beast, while also utilizing powerful removal spells like Murderous Rider and Noxious Grasp to control the opponent's board. Additionally, the inclusion of planeswalkers like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Vraska, Golgari Queen provide additional threats and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and disruption, while also being able to generate card advantage and maintain board presence in longer games.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of removal spells and sacrificing creatures for value. With cards like Vraska, Golgari Queen and Massacre Girl, along with sacrificing synergies like Witch's Oven and Cauldron Familiar, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and generate card advantage. The inclusion of powerful threats like Korvold, Fae-Cursed King and Mayhem Devil ensures that the deck can close out the game quickly once it has gained control. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent through careful resource management.

The main concept of this Esper Control deck is to control the game through various removal spells and disruption cards while generating value through recurring enchantments with Dance of the Manse. The deck aims to dominate the board with Teferi, Time Raveler and Kaya, Orzhov Usurper, while also utilizing Doom Foretold to force sacrifices from the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Guild Globe and Golden Egg for card draw and mana fixing. Overall, the key strategy of this deck is to control the game and outvalue the opponent in the long run.

This Orzhov Control deck focuses on board control and attrition, utilizing powerful removal spells and creatures to outvalue the opponent. The deck includes cards like Liliana, Dreadhorde General and Basilica Bell-Haunt for card advantage and disruption, along with sweepers like Kaya's Wrath to clear the board. The deck also includes life gain and card draw engines like Dawn of Hope and Golden Egg to help stabilize against aggressive decks. Overall, the deck aims to control the game, disrupt the opponent's strategy, and grind out a win through incremental advantage.

The deck focuses on aggressive play with efficient creatures like Dreadhorde Butcher and Knight of the Ebon Legion, supported by removal spells like Murderous Rider and Rankle, Master of Pranks. It aims to apply pressure early on with creatures like Robber of the Rich and Fervent Champion, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Angrath's Rampage and Bedevil. The inclusion of cards like Fling and Shock allows for additional reach to close out games quickly. The mana base is optimized for consistent early plays and card draw with Castles and Fabled Passage.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on putting pressure on the opponent early with aggressive creatures like Bonecrusher Giant, Gruul Spellbreaker, and Questing Beast. The deck also utilizes efficient removal spells like Domri's Ambush to control the board and clear the way for its creatures. Once Upon a Time helps to ensure consistent creature drops, while Embercleave provides a powerful finisher. With a mix of strong creatures, removal, and combat tricks, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and secure a fast victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Fires of Invention enchantment to cast spells without paying their mana cost, allowing for powerful tempo swings and efficient board control. By playing control cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Deafening Clarion, as well as threats like Cavalier of Flames and Gales, the deck aims to dominate the board and outvalue the opponent. With card draw and scrying options, the deck is able to consistently find its key pieces and maintain control of the game while applying pressure through its creatures.

The key concept of this deck is to control the board through various powerful planeswalkers such as Nissa, Oko, and Garruk, along with removal spells like Noxious Grasp and Aether Gust. The deck aims to ramp up mana quickly with creatures like Gilded Goose and Paradise Druid, allowing for early plays of powerful threats like Hydroid Krasis and Wicked Wolf. Additionally, the deck utilizes mana fixing with cards like Once Upon a Time and Fabled Passage to ensure consistent access to its three-color mana base.

This deck focuses on controlling the board and disrupting the opponent's strategy using a combination of counter spells, removal spells, and tempo plays. With a mix of creatures that can be aggressive or defensive, along with versatile spells like Ionize and Brazen Borrower, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. Gadwick, the Wizened serves as both a finisher and card draw engine, while cards like Ral's Outburst and Bonecrusher Giant provide additional value and flexibility in dealing with threats. The mana base allows for consistent casting of spells while also providing options for card selection and deck thinning.

The main focus of this Rakdos Aggro deck is to quickly and consistently apply pressure to the opponent by sacrificing creatures, dealing damage, and controlling the board. Utilizing cards like Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven for constant sac outlet, along with Mayhem Devil for additional damage, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent while drawing cards and disrupting their strategy. With a mix of aggressive creatures and removal spells, the deck seeks to maintain board presence and control to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful planeswalkers and board wipes, while utilizing Fires of Invention to cast spells for free. The goal is to stall the game with cards like Deafening Clarion and Narset, Parter of Veils, until you can overwhelm your opponent with big threats like Sarkhan the Masterless and Kenrith, the Returned King. The deck includes a toolbox of cards in the sideboard to access with Fae of Wishes, allowing for flexibility in answering different threats or situations.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly and aggressively play out low-cost red creatures and spells to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. With cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Fervent Champion, and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and efficient assault. Using burn spells like Shock and Skewer the Critics, along with the advantage from Light Up the Stage, the deck looks to maintain pressure and finish the game before the opponent can stabilize.
